items.text: I enjoy solving complex puzzles and problems.
items.rationale: Engaging in problem-solving is a cognitive activity.

items.text: She often reflects on her past experiences to gain insight.
items.rationale: Reflection and gaining insight are cognitive processes.

items.text: He likes to analyze situations before making a decision.
items.rationale: Analyzing situations involves cognitive processing.

items.text: I frequently engage in debates to challenge my thinking.
items.rationale: Debating involves critical thinking and cognitive engagement.

items.text: She reads extensively to expand her knowledge.
items.rationale: Reading to gain knowledge is a cognitive activity.

items.text: He enjoys learning new languages.
items.rationale: Learning languages involves cognitive skills.

items.text: I often think about the future and plan accordingly.
items.rationale: Thinking about the future and planning are cognitive activities.

items.text: She likes to explore different perspectives on issues.
items.rationale: Exploring perspectives involves cognitive flexibility.

items.text: He frequently questions the status quo.
items.rationale: Questioning norms involves critical thinking.

items.text: I enjoy engaging in intellectual discussions.
items.rationale: Intellectual discussions require cognitive engagement.

items.text: She often contemplates philosophical questions.
items.rationale: Contemplating philosophical questions involves deep cognitive processing.

items.text: He likes to solve riddles and brainteasers.
items.rationale: Solving riddles involves cognitive skills.

items.text: I sometimes find it hard to focus on one task at a time.
items.rationale: Difficulty focusing can relate to cognitive processing but may also involve behavioral aspects.

items.text: She often daydreams about different scenarios.
items.rationale: Daydreaming involves cognitive imagination but can also be seen as affective.

items.text: He often uses his emotions to guide his decisions.
items.rationale: Using emotions in decision-making involves cognition but is closely related to affective processes.

items.text: I often feel overwhelmed by my emotions.
items.rationale: Feeling overwhelmed by emotions is a clear affective experience.

items.text: She experiences intense joy when she achieves her goals.
items.rationale: Experiencing joy is an affective response.

items.text: He tends to react emotionally to criticism.
items.rationale: Emotional reactions to criticism are affective responses.

items.text: I often feel anxious in new situations.
items.rationale: Feeling anxious is an affective state.

items.text: She feels a deep sense of empathy for others.
items.rationale: Empathy is an affective experience.

items.text: He experiences mood swings frequently.
items.rationale: Mood swings are affective phenomena.

items.text: I feel a strong emotional connection to music.
items.rationale: Emotional connections to music are affective experiences.

items.text: She often cries during sad movies.
items.rationale: Crying during movies is an affective response.

items.text: He feels a sense of pride in his accomplishments.
items.rationale: Feeling pride is an affective experience.

items.text: I get easily frustrated when things don't go my way.
items.rationale: Frustration is an affective response.

items.text: She feels a sense of calm when meditating.
items.rationale: Feeling calm is an affective state.

items.text: He often feels nostalgic about his childhood.
items.rationale: Nostalgia involves affective elements but can also involve cognitive reflection.

items.text: I sometimes feel indifferent to things happening around me.
items.rationale: Indifference is an affective state but can also relate to environmental disengagement.

items.text: She often uses logic to suppress her emotions.
items.rationale: Suppressing emotions involves affective regulation but also cognitive control.

items.text: I prefer to act rather than think things through.
items.rationale: Preferring action over thought is a behavioral tendency.

items.text: He often takes initiative in group projects.
items.rationale: Taking initiative is a behavioral trait.

items.text: She is known for her spontaneous decisions.
items.rationale: Spontaneity is a behavioral characteristic.

items.text: I tend to procrastinate on important tasks.
items.rationale: Procrastination is a behavioral pattern.

items.text: He frequently volunteers for new challenges.
items.rationale: Volunteering for challenges is a behavioral action.

items.text: She often changes her routine to keep things interesting.
items.rationale: Changing routines is a behavioral choice.

items.text: I like to keep busy with various activities.
items.rationale: Keeping busy is a behavioral preference.

items.text: He tends to act impulsively in stressful situations.
items.rationale: Impulsivity is a behavioral trait.

items.text: She often follows through on her commitments.
items.rationale: Following through is a behavioral characteristic.

items.text: I enjoy participating in team sports.
items.rationale: Participating in sports is a behavioral activity.

items.text: He is known for his meticulous attention to detail.
items.rationale: Attention to detail is a behavioral trait.

items.text: She often takes calculated risks.
items.rationale: Taking risks is a behavioral action.

items.text: I sometimes find it hard to stick to a routine.
items.rationale: Difficulty with routines is a behavioral issue but can also involve cognitive planning.

items.text: He often acts based on his gut feelings.
items.rationale: Acting on gut feelings is behavioral but involves affective intuition.

items.text: She often plans her actions based on her emotions.
items.rationale: Planning actions based on emotions involves behavior but is closely related to affective processes.

items.text: I feel most comfortable in familiar surroundings.
items.rationale: Comfort in familiar surroundings is an environmental preference.

items.text: He thrives in structured environments.
items.rationale: Thriving in structure is an environmental preference.

items.text: She prefers working in a quiet space.
items.rationale: Preference for quiet spaces is an environmental choice.

items.text: I enjoy being outdoors in nature.
items.rationale: Enjoying nature is an environmental preference.

items.text: He feels energized in urban settings.
items.rationale: Feeling energized in urban settings is an environmental preference.

items.text: She likes to keep her living space organized.
items.rationale: Keeping a space organized is an environmental preference.

items.text: I prefer environments with lots of social interaction.
items.rationale: Preference for social environments is an environmental choice.

items.text: He enjoys the hustle and bustle of city life.
items.rationale: Enjoying city life is an environmental preference.

items.text: She feels at peace in minimalist spaces.
items.rationale: Feeling at peace in minimalist spaces is an environmental preference.

items.text: I like to decorate my space with personal items.
items.rationale: Decorating with personal items is an environmental preference.

items.text: He prefers environments that are constantly changing.
items.rationale: Preference for changing environments is an environmental choice.

items.text: She often rearranges her furniture to change the vibe.
items.rationale: Rearranging furniture is an environmental preference.

items.text: I sometimes feel overwhelmed in crowded places.
items.rationale: Feeling overwhelmed in crowds is an environmental response but can also involve affective elements.

items.text: He often seeks out new environments to explore.
items.rationale: Seeking new environments is an environmental preference but can also involve cognitive curiosity.

items.text: She often changes her environment to match her mood.
items.rationale: Changing environments based on mood involves environmental preferences but is closely related to affective states.

items.text: I enjoy meeting new people and making friends.
items.rationale: Enjoying social interactions is an interpersonal trait.

items.text: He is known for being a good listener.
items.rationale: Being a good listener is an interpersonal skill.

items.text: She often mediates conflicts between friends.
items.rationale: Mediating conflicts is an interpersonal skill.

items.text: I find it easy to empathize with others.
items.rationale: Empathy is a key interpersonal trait.

items.text: He enjoys collaborating on group projects.
items.rationale: Collaboration is an interpersonal activity.

items.text: She often gives advice to her peers.
items.rationale: Giving advice is an interpersonal interaction.

items.text: I like to host gatherings and social events.
items.rationale: Hosting events is an interpersonal activity.

items.text: He is skilled at reading social cues.
items.rationale: Reading social cues is an interpersonal skill.

items.text: She often supports her friends emotionally.
items.rationale: Providing emotional support is an interpersonal trait.

items.text: I enjoy engaging in deep conversations with others.
items.rationale: Engaging in conversations is an interpersonal activity.

items.text: He often seeks feedback from others to improve.
items.rationale: Seeking feedback is an interpersonal interaction.

items.text: She is known for her ability to build strong relationships.
items.rationale: Building relationships is an interpersonal skill.

items.text: I sometimes struggle to maintain long-term friendships.
items.rationale: Struggling with friendships is an interpersonal issue but can also involve affective elements.

items.text: He often feels drained after social interactions.
items.rationale: Feeling drained is an interpersonal response but can also involve affective states.

items.text: She often uses humor to connect with others.
items.rationale: Using humor involves interpersonal skills but is closely related to affective expression.
